editorialSummary.text: Quiet, shady patch of Central Park with black-&-white tile mosaic honoring Beatle John Lennon.

originalText.text: Awesome spot to visit. We came with a tour guide and he explained a lot of details. The only negative was a Beatles cover singer playing music in the "quiet area" expecting tips.

text.text: Awesome spot to visit. We came with a tour guide and he explained a lot of details. The only negative was a Beatles cover singer playing music in the "quiet area" expecting tips.

originalText.text: If you're a Beatles fan, you'll enjoy this place. It's something simple but a beautiful tribute anyway. The place is most of the time surrounded by a lot of people ans music... Beatles' music, of course. Nice atmosphere.

text.text: If you're a Beatles fan, you'll enjoy this place. It's something simple but a beautiful tribute anyway. The place is most of the time surrounded by a lot of people ans music... Beatles' music, of course. Nice atmosphere.

originalText.text:
Strawberry Fields in Central Park, New York City, is a tranquil and iconic memorial dedicated to the legendary musician John Lennon. It serves as a loving tribute to John Lennon, a member of The Beatles, who was tragically killed near this spot in 1980. The memorial is beautifully landscaped and features a circular mosaic with the word "Imagine" at its center, a reference to Lennon's famous song. The mosaic is often adorned with flowers and tributes from visitors.

Located in the park's West Side, Strawberry Fields offers a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle. It's a place where visitors can sit, reflect, and pay their respects to a music legend. Throughout the year, fans from around the world gather here to celebrate John Lennon's life on his birthday (October 9th) and the anniversary of his death (December 8th). It's not uncommon to hear musicians playing Lennon's songs or Beatles classics near the memorial, adding to the serene atmosphere.

We had the privilege of seeing Strawberry Fields blanketed in snow in wintertime, which added an extra layer of beauty and serenity to this already special place. It's not just a place; it's a living tribute to an artist whose music continues to inspire and bring people together. It's a five-star destination for fans and anyone seeking a moment of peace and reflection in the heart of Central Park.

originalText.text:
Iconic spot commemorating one of the greatest musicians to ever live: John Lennon.  Located in Central Park west, this tile mosaic is called Strawberry Fields. It’s a great place to visit, remember and take pictures. It was just a few meters from here when John Lennon was tragically killed … how could that be?!

Imagine all the people, living life in peace. ☮️

originalText.text: There is always some music being played and the crowd with good vibes gathered around. One of my fave places to sit and enjoy in Central Park. I recommend taking a second to sit and enjoy the music here.
